utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Hi. Excuse me.  Um, I'd like to put in this application for my registration.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Hi.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Okay.  Let me see here.  Um, we need--we need your original birth certificate.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: My--my original birth certificate?  But I don't carry that with me.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Right.  Well.  We still need it.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Well, I have my driver's license, does that work?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: No. no  Uh, no one told you that you needed your original birth certificate.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: No it doesn't say it on the form.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: I mean it just says that you need some form of identification, but it doesn't say what kind of identification.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: I mean if I had known--I would have brought it.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: It's almost time for me to go.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I can't believe that--now--are you sure this is absolutely necessary?  Like--

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: There's nothing I can do.  I mean, the government you know--

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: What--what're we gonna do here?  I can't--I can't do this by myself.  I--

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: You're gonna have to.  I mean, you're a great father.  You can do it.  I know you can.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: But, I'm--I'm nothing--I'm nothing without you here.  Maybe we can--we can get out of this somehow.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Well, come on.  You've gotta think of something.  A year--a year away, it's gonna tear us apart.  I don't even--I don't even wanna think about it.  I mean, I don't even know if I'll be able to get in touch with you or--

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Well, we can do the best we can and-and, with um, you know like wireless internet these days--I think that we could-- Talk every once in awhile.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Oh my God.  Guess what, guess what, guess what, guess what, guess what, guess what?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: What?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Well, guess.  Guess, guess, guess, guess.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Um, you--

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Don't look at my left hand.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: No.  Let me see.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Oh, no way.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: He proposed.  He proposed.  Well, and I said yes, of course. [LAUGHTER]

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: That is great.  You look radiant.  I should've guess.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: So, uh, so how's it been going?  I mean, you have any needs or anything?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: I'm--every lead that I get ends up just being a dead end.  You know what I mean.  People are sick of me calling--

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: No.  You can't think that way.  I mean it's good--it's good that you're--that you're calling, you know. you can't

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Yeah, but it--I mean it's the same response you get over and over again.  Like--

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Oh, we're not hiring at this time or thank you, we already have your information on file--We'll call you when we're ready.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Yeah--I know what you mean.  I've gone through like similar stuff, but--

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: But, it's been so long, like--I mine as well just take a job at McDonald's.  Like, I don't--

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: No, come on.  Don't [GARBAGE]

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: I just--I can't do it anymore.  Like, it just takes it out of you--

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Hi, um, excuse me, I believe that the airline lost my baggage.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Um, okay, it didn't--didn't come out on the carrousel--

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: No, it didn't. um It didn't come out and I don't see it anywhere around here, so what can you do about that?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Okay.  Um, well, unfortunately yeah there was a some- some problems with the--

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Some problems?  What is that supposed to mean?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Uh, well some-some of the bags were--were lost on the way over here. uh-

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: How do you lose a suitcase?  A huge suitcase?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: You know, I mean, there's a lot of things that go on under the plane and sometimes, you know, that kind of things happen.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Uh, But, we are willing to reimburse you for the bag and and for the contents--

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: How much?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Hey, a what's up?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Um, Johnny died yesterday.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Wow, that's horrible.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I'm sorry to hear about that.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: We knew that it was coming, but--

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: It seemed like he had a little bit longer.  Like just last week, he was doing was so well.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I mean, you know, at least he's not in anymore pain now, right?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: It's good, you know.  you know It hurts I know.  I know what it's like to lose someone like that.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: So, how's it going?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: It's going really well.  Um, I received something in the mail today.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Oh, you got what?  Where?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: I got into U.S.C.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Oh, no way.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Yeah, I'm so excited.  So I'm gonna say--

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Are you gonna go? you gonna-

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Yeah, I think, I mean because where else would I gonna go?  Like the other places that I applied to I really didn't like that much anyway.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: So--

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Wow, that's...

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Hi, my name is Shiloh, welcome to--Airline Six.  Hi, how may I help you?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Yeah, hello.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Ok.  I've- I've just been talking to this machine for the past half hour and I can't-can't get anything done.  I've been trying to book this vacation this entire time.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: All right, sir.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I know, I'm sorry.  It's-It's just that it's been a little frustrating because--

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: I completely understand.  Automated systems are very difficult sometimes.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Um, how may I help you.  You're trying to book a specific flight?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Well, yeah, I mean I heard there was like these package deals and that maybe I could get a like a hotel or something like that. and-

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: What's he gonna say?  Maybe we ought to tell him before he sees it.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: He saw it.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: How could he see it?  I was the first one up, he was still in bed.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: He was out here when it broke.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: When?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: About four this morning.  I heard it cracking and I woke up and looked out. He was standing right here when it cracked.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: What was he doing out here at four in the morning?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I don't know.  When it cracked, he ran back in the house and cried in the kitchen.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Did you talk to him?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: No.  I thought it was best to leave him alone.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Why did he invite her here?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Why does that bother you?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: She's been in New York for three and half years.  Why all of a sudden?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Well, maybe he just wanted to see her again.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Nobody comes seven hundred miles just to see.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: What do you mean?  He lived next door to the girl all his life.  Why wouldn't he want to see her again?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Don't look at me like that.  He didn't tell me anymore than he told you.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: She's not-

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: How do you know he's even thinking of it?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: -he's not gonna marry her.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: You're the only one I know who loves his parents.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I know, it went out of style, didn't it?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: It's all right.  It's a good thing.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: You know, it's lovely here, the air is sweet.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: You're not sorry you came?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: No, not sorry.  Um, but, I'm- I'm not gonna stay.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Why?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Well, for one thing, your mother as much as told me to go.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Oh.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: You saw that.  I mean and then, well, you've been kind of, um--

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Well, so what do you think?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: About what?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: What I was saying.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: It's ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: It certainly is not.  It's slightly exaggerated scientific fact.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: It's PR.  Somebody sold you a bill of goods that this wonderful event is gonna take place on the beach.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Well, I'm not the only one.  Look at all these people.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Sure, everybody's told the same story.  It keeps us all excited.  It keeps us coming back for more.  It keeps us thinking that life is gonna start any second now if we could just find the right spot and get in on the action.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Are we talking about the same thing?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Well, I'm sorry, but it's still just fish to me.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Good God.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Do you think it's them?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I wonder.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Well, nobody know we're here except Freda and she wouldn't ring up.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Must be them, then.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: What're we gonna do?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: We're all right, darling, aren't we?  Whatever happens.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Now and always, sweet.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I don't care then.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: It was bound to come sooner or later.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Honey, you knew there was nothing in that.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I knew nothing of the sort.  You took presents from him.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Presents?  Just a trivial little broach.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Ah, yes, I remember it well.  Bristling with diamonds in the worst possible taste.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: No, it wasn't.  It was very pretty.  I still have it and I wear it often.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: No, I didn't.  You worked the whole thing up in your jealous imagination.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: You must admit, he was in love with you, wasn't he?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Just a little perhaps, nothing serious.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: All right. Finally. Here you go.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Hi, How can I help you?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Yea. I just want to get this done,

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Sure, um

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: get my new license.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: do you have two forms of ID with you?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Um, no, I got my driver's license though.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: I actually need two forms of ID. I need either a passport or a birth certificate, or social security card. I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Uh, sorry, I forgot them. I mean I've got to -

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Well

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Oh, you're never going to believe it.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: What? What? You look really happy what's going on?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Well, I finally did it

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Finally did what?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I-I asked her to marry me.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: You did? Oh, my Gosh, I'm so proud of you.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Yes, I know. [LAUGHTER]

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Oh, my Gosh. Well, and did

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I'm so nervous you know, I'm-

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Uhm, I don't know

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: So how you feeling?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I don't know what I'm going to do about this; I mean

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I have got to get a job, you know? Like-

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: You've been doing a lot of work for it, right?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Well, yea you know, I get my resumes and I mean I-

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Right, so the fact you doing the best that you can is -

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I go out all the places I can, every place that'll give an interview you know.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: you know you shouldn't give yourself a hard time for that, it's the best you can.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: But it's been so long, like what - what am I - what am I waiting -- I should probably just do something else, or

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Hi. Um-

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Hi, can I help you?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: It seems that uh- my-my bag didn't make it out on the carousel.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Oh, did you check? Did you make sure as it went around the second time that it-

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Yes, yes, it's gone around like you know twenty times. It's been about a half hour.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Okay. Well, um- the f.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Actually I'm looking here at the information, the flight that you were on we had some trouble with some of the baggage, it looks like a few peoples' bags didn't make it through. Um, so-

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Okay. So what-what do I have to get you know

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Well, you can fill out this paperwork um- and if for some reason it shows up, we can bring it to you, but-

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: For some reason, so you think it won't show up?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: What's going on?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Kathy died last night.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Oh my God. Oh my God, I'm so sorry.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: yeah, I mean, you know, it was a -

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I guess we saw it coming and she lasted a lot - a lot longer than, uh, they expected but you know, I mean when it actually happens it's just a lot harder.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: It doesn't make any easier, yes.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I mean at least she was home, she wasn't in the hospital anymore,

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Oh, man. I'm so sorry.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: She was with- yeah  She was with Gary, and he said that she was just sitting there and went to sleep, closed her eyes, and that was it.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: It's going to be so rough, I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: [BREATHING] So, you know I've been hearing back from some colleges.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Oh, yeah? Have you gotten letters yet?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Yeah. And guess who accepted me?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Um, I don't know, where?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: U.S.C..

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Oh, U.S.C.? Oh my Gosh, that's awesome, that was your top choice, right?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Oh my Gosh, that's so cool.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Yeah, oh. I - You have no-

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: God, I-I got this big packet you know, in the mail and it's like-

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: All right. Customer service this is Steve.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Hi. Thank you so much, you're a real person, right, you're not like a recording?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I'm a real person, yes.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Okay. Before I get into it, um your menu or whatever like where you choose the different thing depending on the-

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: it leads you around in circles, you can't, there is no way to like get to a real person if you don't already know how to get to there.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Right. No, yes I know. It is-It is a little frustrating.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: So is there any way to like bypass that because that is so, like I've been going around in circles

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: like press nine, press zero, press back to the menu, like I can't get through to what I'm supposed to get through to.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I- I'll give you a little hint, next time if it asks if you're on a rotary phone you know, just stay on the line instead of - instead of hitting one or two to say if you're like on a touch tone

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: What's he going to say, maybe we ought to tell him before he sees it.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: He saw it.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: How could he see it? I was the first one up he was still in bed.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: He was out here when it broke.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: When?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: About four this morning. I heard it cracking and I woke up and looked out. He was standing right here when it cracked.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: What was he doing out here at four in the morning?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I don't know. When it cracked he ran into the house and cried in the kitchen.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: So you talked to him?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: No. I figured it was best to leave him alone.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Why did he invite her here?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Why does that bother you?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: She's been in New York three and half years why all of a sudden-

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Well, maybe he just wanted to see her again.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Nobody comes seven hundred miles just to see.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: What do you mean? He lived next door to the girl all his life, why wouldn't he want to see her again?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Don't look at me like that, he didn't tell me any more than he told you.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: He's not going to marry her.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: How do you know he's even thinking of it?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: It's got that all about it.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: You're the only one I know who loves his parents.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I know, it went out of style, didn't it?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: It's all right.  It's a good thing.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: You know, it's lovely here, the air is sweet.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: You're not sorry you came?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: No, not sorry.  But, um. But I'm not gonna stay.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Why?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: For one thing, your mother as much as told me to go.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Oh.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: You saw that.  I mean and then, well, you've been kind of, um--

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: So what do you think?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: About what?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: What I was saying.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: It's ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Certainly it's not. Slightly exaggerated scientific fact.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: It's PR. Someone sold you a bill of goods that this wonderful event is going to take place on the beach.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Well, I'm not the only one look at all these people.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Yea, sure everyone was sold the same story. I mean it keeps us all excited, keeps us coming back for more, keeps us thinking that life is going to start any second now if we can just get in on the action and find the right spot.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Are we talking about the same thing?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: I'm sorry but it's still just fish to me.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Good God.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Do you think it's them?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I wonder.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Well, nobody knows we're here except Freda and she wouldn't ring up.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Must be them then.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: What are we going to do?

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: We're all right darling, aren't we whatever happens?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Now and always sweet.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I don't care then.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: It's bound to come sooner or later.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: You knew there was nothing in that.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: I knew nothing of the sort. You took presents from him.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Presents, just a trivial little broach.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: Yes, I remember it well, bristling with diamonds in the worst possible taste.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: No it wasn't. It was very pretty I still have it and I wear it often.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: No I didn't, you worked the whole thing up in your jealous imagination.

utterances.speaker: Male
utterances.text: You must admit he was in love with you, wasn't he?

utterances.speaker: Female
utterances.text: Just a little perhaps, nothing serious.
